resources.string: Healthy lifestyle choices can help you bring your blood sugar level back to normal, or at least keep it from rising toward the levels seen in type 2 diabetes.
To prevent prediabetes from progressing to type 2 diabetes, try to:

1. Eat healthy foods. Choose foods low in fat and calories and high in fiber. Focus on fruits, vegetables and whole grains. Eat a variety of foods to help you achieve your goals without compromising taste or nutrition.
2. Be more active. Aim for at least 150 minutes of moderate or 75 minutes of vigorous aerobic activity a week.

3. Lose excess weight. If you re overweight, losing just 5% to 7% of your body weight about 14 pounds 6.4 kilograms if you weigh 200 pounds 91 kilograms can reduce the risk of type 2 diabetes. To keep your weight in a healthy range, focus on permanent changes to your eating and exercise habits.
4. Stop smoking. Smoking may up your risk of developing type 2 diabetes.

5. ake medications as needed. If you re at high risk of diabetes, your doctor might recommend metformin (Glumetza, others). Medications to control cholesterol and high blood pressure might also be prescribed.

Description: These are anti-inflammatory medications and should relieve the main symptoms of eczema, such as inflammation and itchiness. People can apply them directly to the skin. Some people may benefit from prescription-strength medications.

Description: If topical treatments are not effective, a doctor may prescribe oral medications like systemic corticosteroids or immunosuppresants. These are available as injections or oral tablets. People should only use them for short periods of time. Also, it is important to note that the symptoms may worsen upon stopping these drugs if the person is not already taking another medication for the condition.
Doctors prescribe antibiotics if eczema occurs alongside a bacterial skin infection.
Description: These can reduce the risk of nighttime scratching, as they tend to cause drowsiness.
Description: This drug suppresses the activities of the immune system. It decreases inflammation and helps prevent flares.
Description: These reduce water loss and work to repair the skin.
Description: This involves exposure to UVA or UVB waves. This method can treat moderate dermatitis. A doctor will monitor the skin closely throughout the treatment.
Description: These medications block proteins in the immune system to limit immune system response.
1.A receding hairline typically around the forehead, temples, or nape
2.Small pimples appear on the scalp or at the base of braids
3.Redness, itching, and ulcers on the scalp
5.Patches of thin or broken hair in places where the hair has been under strain
6.patches of shiny, scarred skin in more advanced cases
Description: If a personâ€™s religion or profession require tight hairstyles, they should tie their hair as loosely as possible and wear their hair loose or down whenever possible.
Avoid or limit chemicals, including relaxers.
Description: Avoid putting relaxer onto already relaxed hair.
Description: To prevent strain on one area of the scalp.

Description: Around 40 percentTrusted Source of people using a minoxidil product regrow some hair after 3 to 6 months. The United States Food and Drug Administration (FDA)Trusted Source have approved Rogaine, but people should not use it if their scalp is red or inflamed.
Description: Steroid creams can reduce swelling on the scalp caused by traction alopecia.
